description:
time: add syscall.Timeval to time.Duration conversion

Fixes issue 2534.

messages.text:
This adds syscall to the exported time API. Is that a good move?

Also, how portable is syscall.Timeval? According to the autogenerated
files in the Go tree, its fields are int32 on some systems, and int64
on others.


Dave.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

Yeah, this feels gross.

On Fri, Dec 16, 2011 at 6:43 PM, David Symonds <dsymonds@golang.org> wrote:

> This adds syscall to the exported time API. Is that a good move?
>
> Also, how portable is syscall.Timeval? According to the autogenerated
> files in the Go tree, its fields are int32 on some systems, and int64
> on others.
>
>
> Dave.
>

Fair enough. 

Sent from my iPhone

On 17/12/2011, at 18:57, Brad Fitzpatrick <bradfitz@golang.org> wrote:

> Yeah, this feels gross.
> 
> On Fri, Dec 16, 2011 at 6:43 PM, David Symonds <dsymonds@golang.org> wrote:
> This adds syscall to the exported time API. Is that a good move?
> 
> Also, how portable is syscall.Timeval? According to the autogenerated

> on others.
>

> Dave.
